title: Senior Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We're seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our Graph team and enhance the search functionality within our multi-tenant service. This role requires significant experience designing, implementing, and maintaining Elasticsearch/OpenSearch in a production environment. You will own projects from initial requirements gathering (PRD) through to successful completion, collaborating with customers to ensure solutions meet their specific needs.
   

  

 As part of our team, you'll contribute to building cutting-edge features leveraging serverless compute, auto-scaling OpenSearch clusters, and LLMs with Machine Learning nodes. We are a team that prioritizes high code quality in every commit.
   

  

**Why is this team critical to Optimizely?**
* Business Impact: Graph is the core content delivery and search service powering the SaaS version of our Content Management System (CMS). Our customers, who rely on Graph for their websites and mobile applications, demand high performance and advanced query capabilities to deliver exceptional user experiences. Graph's reliability and speed directly impact their business success.
* High Visibility & Innovation: Our roadmap prioritizes innovative content delivery and search features, placing search and AI at the forefront of our service offering. This focus differentiates us from competitors and empowers our customers to build cutting-edge web and mobile applications. You'll be instrumental in developing these differentiating features.
* Shape the Future of Digital Experiences: The team plays a critical role in shaping the future of our customers' digital presence. Your contributions will directly influence how they engage their audiences and achieve their business objectives through innovative search and content delivery experiences


**Experience Required:**
* 5+ years’ experience of developing and managing services in production
* Experience managing Elasticsearch / OpenSearch in production, with optimization of settings, shards, and replicas.
* Experience creating optimized Elasticsearch / OpenSearch queries
* Experience developing with TypeScript
* Expertise with API design and development of GraphQL or RESTful web services
* Partnering closely with internal stakeholders to gain a strong understanding of business and product data needs
* You find satisfaction in being a force multiplier for your colleagues
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or engineering or related experience require


**Some technologies we work with:**
* Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* GraphQL, REST
* TypeScript, JavaScript, C#
* Cloudflare workers, Kubernetes


**What sets you apart:**
* Experience developing GraphQL APIs
* Experience in Kubernetes, Docker etc. and/ or serverless cloud stacks
* Experience developing multi-tenant services
* Experience of Machine Learning in Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* Experience working with go-to-market teams
* Understanding the value of pair programming/TDD/Clean Code
* Exposure/Experience leveraging functional languages / paradigms


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Engagement Manager, ProServe EMEA North
job_function: Project Management, Management, and Product Management
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a highly skilled and versatile Engagement Manager (EM) to join our team and lead the delivery of complex cloud solution projects.
   

  

 In this role you will combine technical expertise with strong project leadership skills to drive successful implementations of AWS-based solutions for our clients. You will bridge business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating technical discussions and ensuring alignment with customer outcomes. Applying AWS frameworks like Well-Architected and Cloud Adoption Framework while demonstrating technical credibility across diverse stakeholders, you will distill customer needs into clear technical requirements, decompose complex problems, and make informed trade-off decisions considering performance, scalability, security, and business impact.
   

  

 Possessing strong technology and program/project management experience, you will validate technical solutions against business goals, recognize when additional technical evaluation is needed, and manage technical risks. You will be expected to achieve and maintain relevant AWS certifications, develop domain-specific expertise, and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and business audiences. As you progress, you’ll lead increasingly complex technical projects, shape cross-organizational technical strategies, and establish best practices in your domain. In this role you will apply your management and leadership capabilities to successfully execute project plans, proactively identify and manage risks, resolve issues, escalate when appropriate, and drive projects to successful completion, while exceeding customer expectation The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud.
   

  

 We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Leading and managing complex cloud migration and implementation projects
* Leveraging comprehensive knowledge of AWS services, architectures, and best practices to guide technical decisions and strategic planning  Bridging business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating engineering discussions and ensuring alignment with customer business outcomes
* Distilling customer needs into clear technical requirements and map them to business outcomes - Decomposing complex technical problems into actionable, deliverable solutions
* Contributing to technical documentation and define documentation standards


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences:
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

**Inclusive Team Culture**
 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

**Mentorship & Career Growth**
 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 5+ years Project Management hands-on experience in managing and delivering enterprise level IT projects, with external customers or equivalent experience
* Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple and concurrent projects/customers.
* Led teams and engagements utilizing agile approaches, value and principles as well as Scrum framework
* Understands the value proposition of cloud services and has delivered cloud engagements
* Experience with Agile and Project Management (APM) toolsets (Jira, RallyDev, VersionOne, Taiga, etc).


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Has at least one active project management certification (e.g., APM, CSM, PMI-ACP, PRINCE2)
* Managed technical projects consisting of 8 or more people totaling over $1,000,000 budget and managed and delivered IT engagements for Nordic large enterprise customers.
* Managed engagements using Agile/Iterative methodologies.
* Possesses a deep knowledge of Agile and Scaled program management best practices and how to pragmatically apply across large, complex projects.
* Has presented to C-level executives (CIO, CEO, CTO, CISO, etc.) as well as to technical subject matter experts.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2924121

title: Vikarierande bibliotekarie Sjöängsskolan
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Beskrivning
   

  

 Sjöängsskolan är vackert belägen vid Örby slott i Älvsjö. Vi är en treparallellig F-9-skola med både elever från vårt närområde med villabebyggelse och elever mer långväga ifrån. Vår skola är en mötesplats för elever med olika bakgrund, något som vi sätter värde på och är stolta över. Ett signum för Sjöängsskolan är vår kompetenta personalgrupp. Vi har ett stabilt, engagerat och samarbetsinriktat kollegium. Hos oss är elevens utveckling och lärande i centrum och vi arbetar med ständig utveckling för att varje elev hos oss ska utvecklas optimalt. Vi tror på ett långsiktigt och systematiskt kvalitetsarbete med undervisningen i fokus och vi arbetar främjande och förebyggande i vårt elevhälsoarbete.
   

  

 Sjöängsskolans skolbibliotek har av Fackförbundet DIK utsetts ha ett skolbibliotek i världsklass.
   

  

 Läs mer på http://www.sjoangsskolan.stockholm.se
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som bibliotekarie i skolbiblioteket har du ett pedagogiskt uppdrag utifrån stadens skolbiblioteksplan och skolans övriga styrdokument. Det handlar om att stärka skolans läskultur, stötta elevernas läsutveckling och språkliga förmåga samt digitala kompetens och arbeta mot en höjd måluppfyllelse, för en likvärdig skola. Skolbiblioteket är en verksamhet för hela skolan och är inte enbart knuten till bibliotekslokalen och arbetet innebär många kontakter med elever och personal på skolan.
   

  

 Du förväntas initiera, planera och genomföra olika läsfrämjande aktiviteter kopplade till läroplanen tillsammans med lärarna på skolan samt på egen hand. Det inkluderar exempelvis litteraturpresentationer, boksamtal och andra aktiviteter som kan väcka och stärka elevernas läslust och språkliga förmåga. Du ska även arbeta pedagogiskt med medie-och informationskunnighet. Det innebär exempelvis undervisning i käll- och sökkritik samt biblioteks- och internetkunnighet. Du håller dig uppdaterad genom kompetensutveckling och kontinuerlig omvärldsbevakning inom dessa områden.
   

  

 Du stödjer elever i behov av anpassad läsning genom att bland annat tillhandahålla talböcker och lättlästa medier. Att främja läsning på elevernas modersmål och stärka flerspråkighet är ett annat prioriterat område liksom att synliggöra de nationella minoritetsspråken.
   

  

 Skolbiblioteket ska erbjuda ett brett utbud av medier och verksamheter som bidrar till bildning, vidgar perspektiven och stärker elevernas lärande och nyfikenhet. Du ansvarar för inköp, gallring och annat underhåll av medier för att skapa ett relevant och lockande utbud i skolbiblioteket. Du ansvarar för skolbiblioteksrummet och arbetar för att skolbiblioteket är en socialt, pedagogiskt och fysiskt tillgänglig lärmiljö.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* har examen i Biblioteks- och informationsvetenskap, bibliotekarieexamen eller utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig
* tycker om att arbeta med barn och ungdomar och är nyfiken på deras lärande


 har god kännedom om aktuell barn- och ungdomslitteratur och kan inspirera till läsning
   

  

* har hög digital kompetens och kan instruera och vägleda elever och pedagoger i användning av digitala verktyg och informationskällor
* har förmåga att utveckla en aktiv och strukturerad skolbiblioteksverksamhet i samverkan med övrig pedagogisk personal
* har en god förmåga att samarbeta med både vuxna och barn och kan skapa möjligheter för dem att vara delaktiga i skolbibliotekets verksamhet
* kan uttrycka dig på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt
* håller dig uppdaterad inom ditt kompetensområde


 Det är meriterande om du har vana att leda grupper och erfarenhet av att arbeta med Book-it.
   

  

 Du är initiativrik, självgående och utåtriktad.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 I Stockholms stad finns drygt 140 grundskolor och 30 gymnasieskolor med olika inriktningar.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid/deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 75% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/1431 | Kontakt: Ann-Charlotte Karlsson 08-50821411, | Publicerat: 2025-03-10 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-24

title: Senior Financial Risk Analyst to SEB Kort I Solna
description:
Are you a strong team player who thrives in a data driven environment? We are looking for a Risk Analyst to join our Risk & Capital Management team in SEB Kort.
   

  

 SEB Kort Bank is a fully owned subsidiary of SEB, operating mainly in the Nordics, Central Europe and North America after recently acquiring AirPlus. SEB Kort’s business targets two strategic areas; corporates and consumers. In both areas, SEB Kort works from two different brand perspectives: our own brands, and several partner brands. Following the acquisition of AirPlus an integral part is to merge the businesses and become a leading provider of corporate payment solutions in Europe with a global reach.
   

  

**About The Role**
 SEB Kort’s Risk & Capital management function is a team of eight people currently placed in Stockholm, however, the position is open for all our Nordic home markets. The main focus areas are credit risk optimization and governance, development of pricing models to increase profitability as well as regulatory adherence.
   

  

**In the role as Risk Analyst your main responsibilities will be in the areas of:**
* Developing the credit underwriting, improving pre-collection and collection processes, evaluating and implementing new data sources, focusing on risk and profitability.
* Developing risk management processes using data as your main tool.
* Ensuring data quality and data quality controls.
* Supporting the business, and other teams, with data driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Developing monitoring and internal reporting of financial risk metrics to be reported to SEB Kort management and other relevant stakeholders.
* You will be working closely with the business, IT and other stakeholders across SEB Kort, as well as in SEB Group.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

 You are a highly motivated, structured, curious, detail- and service-oriented person. You are a doer with a proactive mindset that work independently and take own initiatives. Further, you are a strong team player who can interact professionally with a broad range of colleagues of various backgrounds.
   

  

**Your preferred background:**
* 3+ years of relevant experience.
* Analytical skills and knowledge to handle complex information.
* Programming skills in SAS and SQL queries or equivalent.
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in economics, engineering, mathematics or similar.
* Good stakeholder management skills and the ability to collaborate cross-divisionally.
* Proficient in spoken and written English and a Scandinavian language.


 What we offer
   

  

* An opportunity to develop risk management capabilities and be a close partner to the business.
* Innovative working environment with highly motivated colleagues.
* International environment with extensive learning opportunities.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 23rd of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Louies Abrahamsson Kwetczer at louise.abrahamssonkwetczer@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner Sebastian Vesterlund at sebastian.vesterlund @seb.se
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Staff Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


 As a
 **Staff Android Engineer** 
 in the Calling team, you will drive the technical direction and execution of our Android platform, playing a pivotal role in the exploration, development, and implementation of new solutions. The ideal candidate is deeply technical, passionate about building great user experiences, and committed to delivering value.
   

  

 What do we expect from you:
   

  

* 5+ years of total engineering experience, with at least 2 years as a senior or staff engineer
* Strong commitment to improving user experience through exceptional engineering
* Deep technical knowledge of Android development, including the Android SDK
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs
* Strong proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git
* Excellent communication skills, thriving in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken


 What will you work on:
   

  

* Lead technical decisions, ensuring we build high-quality, scalable Android applications
* Participate actively in product prioritization discussions, providing clear and thoughtful technical insights
* Architect, develop, and maintain robust Android solutions, emphasizing performance and usability
* Communicate complex technical decisions clearly and effectively
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, translating requirements into technical deliverables
* Stay current with emerging Android technologies, tools, and best practices, integrating relevant innovations into the team's workflow
* Actively contribute to coding, maintaining a hands-on approach in delivering robust solutions
* Establish relationships and drive alignment within the team, and with external teams (when necessary).


 It would be great if you also have:
   

  

* Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices as well as an eye for design
* Experience as an Architect


 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
   

  

**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**We only accept applications in English.**
**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team** 
 : An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **How do we work:** 
 We're an office-based company with the flexibility to work from home on Fridays.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you.

title: Payroll Expert, Sweden
description:
**Who We Are Is What We Do.**
 Deel and our family of growing companies are made up of global teams dedicated to helping businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily.
   

  

 The team comprises over three thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 100 countries, and our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the platform and products for customers.
   

  

 Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the platform’s success. We deliver the best products and features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.
   

  

**Why should you be part of our success story?**
 A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because exceptional talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.
   

  

 We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.
   

  

 After our successful Series D in 2021, we raised another $50M in 2023, doubling our valuation to $12B. There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the international payroll and compliance market leader.
   

  

 What you'll do:
   

  

* Ensure accurate and timely execution of payroll in your region, as well as in other trained countries
* Own all critical local payroll and HR processes, including setting up involuntary deductions, supporting onboardings and offboardings of employees on record in your designated location
* Prepare and reconcile internal payroll reports, ensuring compliance with local tax authorities
* Prepare schedules to collect payroll expenses from various sources and reconcile collections to expenses
* Answer complex payroll and HR related questions from employees and clients in your designated location
* Schedule payroll expenses collections and reconcile collections to expenses
* Assess and improve rapid growth processes and procedures, ensuring compliance
* Stay informed of relevant local regulatory and policies changes, communicating and establishing key changes across teams
* Work cross-functionally to provide expertise on local payroll and HR matters in your designated location
* Evaluate and select relevant software for running payroll, incorporating Deel product technology requirements


 Key Qualifications:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Accounting or a related field from an accredited institution
* Strong working knowledge of local regulations and policies related to payroll
* Ability to prioritize multiple tasks while meeting deadlines timely and accurately
* Strong verbal and written communication skills to communicate with clients and coordinate and align with various stakeholders across teams
* Strong interpersonal skills to be able to communicate with employees and explain complex issues at an understandable level
* Advanced knowledge of local payroll software solutions
* Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel
* Strong proficiency in English


**Total Rewards**
 Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.
   

  

**Some things you’ll enjoy**
* Provided computer equipment tailored to your role
* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including WeWork access where available


**DISCLOSURE**
 We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications.Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.
   

  

 We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on the 19th of February, 2025.
   

  

 For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy.
   

  

 You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144.
   

  

 At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
   

  

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @* 
*deel.com* 
*and other acquired company emails like @* 
*payspace.com* 
*and @* 
*paygroup.com* 
*. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting* 
*our careers page* 
*.*
*Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.
   

  

 Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.*

title: Systemarkitekt
description:
*Brinner du för att driva förändring av komplexa IT-lösningar med hjälp av nya tekniker och agila arbetssätt? Här på Fondliv är vi mitt i en spännande omvandling där vi fokuserar på att modernisera vårt IT-landskap och leverera mervärde till våra kunder på ett snabbare sätt än någonsin tidigare. Vi utforskar nya tekniker och lösningar för att bygga en mer effektiv IT-miljö med hjälp av moderna och agila arbetssätt. Vi förstärker nu vårt team med ytterligare en kompetent medarbetare. Vill du vara med och forma framtiden med oss? Läs då vidare!*  


**Om jobbet**
Som Systemarkitekt (Tågarkitekt) i vårt arkitekturteam kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i vår pågående digitala transformation inom liv- och pensionsområdet. Tillsammans med dina kollegor kommer du att arbeta med övergripande arkitektur, modernisering och avveckling av system samt digitalisering och automatisering för att möjliggöra vår digitala förflyttning. Du rapporterar direkt till Chef Arkitektur & Projektledning och samarbetar nära arkitekter både inom Fondliv och övriga Länsförsäkringar, samt våra utvecklingsteam och leverantörer.  


**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**  


* Planera och utveckla tågets Architectural Runway, samt att ta fram och kommunicera en arkitekturell vision för tåget.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturella enablers finns i tågets backlogg.
* Bidra och delta i planering och prioritering av arbetet med fokus på att klargöra systemsambanden på de nivåer som krävs för att lösningarna kan utvecklas i önskad riktning.
* Delta i tågcermonier som t.ex. PI-planering, demos och I&A.
* Säkerställa att föreslagna tekniska lösningar håller ihop och koordineras inom tåget och att ny funktionalitet stödjer den arkitekturella visionen.
* Tillsammans med teamen säkerställa att systemen uppfyller kvalitetsbehov och coacha utvecklare för ökad förståelse.
* Aktivt bidra under Continuous Exploration-fasen, som en del av Continuous Delivery Pipeline, med tyngd på området enablers.
* Säkerställa lämpligheten i framtagna lösningar med relevanta intressenter utanför det egna tåget.


**Vem är du?**
Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt. Som person är du ansvarstagande, tar ägandeskap och har förmågan att begripliggöra tekniska lösningar för personer utan teknisk kompetens. Du kan strukturera upp angreppssätt för att lösa problem, definiera vägen framåt både från ett helhetsperspektiv och för specifika områden och får energi av att driva förflyttningen. Vidare är du en god kommunikatör som är lyhörd och samarbetar bra med andra människor. Precis som vi andra inom arkitekturteamet är du intresserad av och vill jobba kunddrivet enligt moderna metoder och agila arbetssätt. Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.  


**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har kompetens inom ett eller flera av följande områden:**  


* Lösningsarkitektur med fokus på olika typer av mjukvara.
* Molnlösningar och SaaS-tjänster och en gradvis förflyttning från On-Prem till Cloud.
* Integrationsarkitektur och API-lösningar.
* Vara med och forma den agila arkitekturförmågan och förflyttning mot DevOps.
* Informationsförsörjning och masterdata i ett komplext IT-landskap.
* Infrastruktur- och IT-säkerhetsarkitektur.


Kompetens från att tidigare ha arbetat med pensionsrelaterade produktsystem är meriterande.  


**Om oss**
Vi välkomnar dig till gruppen Arkitektur och projektledning, som samlar de roller på IT-Liv som arbetar på bredden över hela Liv-domänen. Gruppen består idag av 12 personer, anställda och konsulter. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Fondliv är liv- och pensionsförsäkringsbolaget inom Länsförsäkringar och är en av Sveriges största aktörer på pensionsmarknaden. Vi är ett kundägt bolag med stort samhällsengagemang och fokus på hållbarhet. På Fondliv planerar vi stora tekniska förflyttningar de närmsta åren och det finns gott om spännande utmaningar och stora möjligheter att utvecklas.  


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande?* *Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2025-03-30**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Fredrik Andlin
**Kontaktuppgifter:** fredrik.andlin@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Be visionary
Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.  

Job Description  

Are you a Senior DevOps Engineer? Join our innovative team at Teledyne FLIR Defense!
Teledyne FLIR Defense is a global leader in defense technologies and integrated sensing solutions with 15,000 employees globally. Since 1978, we have been at the forefront of innovation, continuously pushing boundaries. Our diversified portfolio serves a variety of applications in government and defense, helping military personnel operate efficiently and effectively in various environments.
We are now looking for a passionate and talented full-time Senior DevOps consultant to join our team in Arninge/Täby to help us continue to lead the way in surveillance technology. If you're excited about making a difference in the world and working with cutting-edge technologies, this is the place for you!
What We Offer* A Friendly and Inclusive Culture: Join a team that values collaboration, problem-solving, and creativity.
* Global Team: Work alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
* Great Team and Culture: Collaborate with other talented engineers in a supportive environment.
* Financially Stable and Growing Company: Be part of a company that is financially secure and expanding.
* Healthcare Benefits: Access to healthcare benefits, free gym, and various sports activities.

Responsibilities* Develop and maintain Ansible scripts for deployment and management of Linux-based virtualized development servers.
* Use Git for version control of Ansible, Groovy, and autotest scripts.
* Drive and improve CI/CD processes with automated testing.
* Configure and troubleshoot servers and embedded systems within a corporate network.

Qualifications* Required Skills:
* Ansible
* Jenkins
* Git
* Linux
* CI/CD
* Networking (DNS, LDAP, Certificates)
* Virtualization

Preferred Skills* Atlassian Bitbucket/Jira/Confluence
* Ubuntu/Debian
* Yocto Linux
* CI/CD for embedded systems
* VMWare Vcenter
* Artifactory
* Docker

Personal Traits for Success* Ability to work independently while being part of a team with both shared and individual responsibilities.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

Security Clearance
Due to the high-security demands of the defense industry, you will need to undergo a background check. The person needs to be able to work in Sweden, and we perform security background checks on all our employees. This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e., regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.
We prefer applicants who are okay with working on-site from the office in Arninge/Täby.  

Join us and contribute to the next generation of defense technology!  

Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
.

title: DevOps-specialist nivå 3
description:
DevOps-specialist nivå 3 – Spännande uppdrag hos en myndighet

Åt kund söker vi en erfaren DevOps-specialist för ett 2,5 år långt uppdrag inom IT-systemutveckling. Kunden är en myndighet som arbetar med att säkerställa ett robust och effektivt el överföringssystem för framtiden.

Om rollen

Som DevOps-specialist kommer du att ansvara för nyutveckling och förvaltning av Linux-miljöer, CI/CD-pipelines samt installation av applikationer för egenutvecklade system. Du blir en del av ett agilt team med beställare, kravställare och utvecklare där du får en nyckelroll i att utveckla och automatisera processer.

Arbetsuppgifter

Bygga upp och förvalta driftmiljöer i Red Hat Linux 9

Etablera processer för vidareutveckling och förvaltning av driftmiljöer

Säkerställa och härda driftmiljöer samt kommunikation

Automatisera bygg- och deployment-processer i CI/CD-pipelines

Planera och implementera loggning av applikationer och plattformar

Arbeta proaktivt och bidra med förbättringsförslag

Vem vi söker

Vi söker dig med 5–9 års erfarenhet inom DevOps och en gedigen bakgrund inom IT-utveckling. Du är självgående, initiativrik och trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du får ta ansvar och leda mindre grupper vid behov.

Krav:

Minst 5 års erfarenhet av DevOps-utveckling och automation av CI/CD-pipelines

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av containerisering, gärna Podman, Docker eller Kubernetes

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med Ansible

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Git och GitOps

Meriterande:

Erfarenhet av Bash/Python för automatisering

Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps för versions- och ärendehantering

Erfarenhet av Prometheus/Loki/Grafana för övervakning och loggning

Placering & omfattning

Plats: Sundbyberg, med möjlighet att arbeta upp till 50 % på distans

Omfattning: 100 % under hela uppdragstiden

Säkerhetsprövning

Uppdraget kräver säkerhetsprövning.

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Sista ansökningsdatum: 2025-03-17

title: Data Analyst – Kiruna heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en av våra kunders räkning söker vi nu en Data Analyst. Vår kund är ett stabilt och tryggt konsultbolag med stark ekonomi. Företaget erbjuder intressanta uppdrag inom offentlig sektor, med fokus på samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar, och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal. Företaget har funnits sedan 2003 och består idag av ett 100-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Kiruna. Du kommer även ha möjligheten att arbeta hemifrån.
  
I din roll kommer du att bidra till att skapa nya insikter och främja datadrivet beslutsfattande hos företagets kunder. Företagets kunder står inför utmaningar där de behöver dra nytta av digitaliseringens möjligheter för att effektivisera och automatisera sina verksamheter. Det finns ett ökat behov av kompetens kring avancerad statistisk analys och automation. Du kommer att tillhöra företagets beslutsstödsteam. Teamet jobbar Microsoftorienterat.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom dataanalys eller statistik
  
har minst 3 års erfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker
  
erfarenhet av prediktionsanalys
  
erfarenhet av Power BI
  
har en vana av att arbeta med komplexa miljöer med fokus på att skapa rätt handlingar från data
  
har erfarenhet av agil utvecklingspraxis som ex. SCRUM, Kanban, DevOps
  
har goda SQL-kunskaper
  
behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

erfarenhet av SSIS/SSAS, kunskap i R eller Python, samt erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer ex. Azure eller AWS.
  
kunskaper inom informationssäkerhet, GDPR och säker implementering av analysverktyg.
  
  

**Du får:**  

Uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar
  
En anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och samarbeten
  
Balans i livet där det finns plats för både familj och fritid
  
En kompetensresa som är unik för dig och din karriärresa
  
En trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och bra förmåner
  
En lönemodell som kombinerar anställningstrygghet med rörlig del och vinstdelning
  
En platt organisation med närhet till ledning och stor delaktighet
  
  

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Data Analyst – Kiruna heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Software Test Automation Engineer
description:
In this role, you’ll be an integral part of our mission to deliver high-quality software products. Working in a collaborative, agile environment, you’ll design, develop, and execute automated tests that ensure our products meet the highest standards. Your work will directly contribute to creating a culture of continuous improvement and excellence, helping us push boundaries in the property management technology space.
  
  

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include
  
Designing and developing automated test frameworks and scripts to ensure robust software quality.
  
Implementing performance and load testing strategies to validate application scalability.
  
Integrating automated tests into CI/CD pipelines and monitoring their performance.
  
Collaborating with developers to identify test coverage needs and troubleshoot issues.
  
Analyzing test results to provide insights into product readiness and quality.
  
Leading cross-team quality initiatives and mentoring team members in test automation best practices.
  
  

**Required Experience :**  

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  
**Technical Expertise:** Strong understanding of QA best practices, automation, test plan creation, regression/release testing, and experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
  
Expertise in API testing and automation for RESTful and SOAP services.
  
Hands-on experience with CI/CD integration and version control tools like Git.
  
Strong understanding of software testing methodologies, including Agile, DevOps, and Shift-left testing.
  
Familiarity with cloud-based testing solutions and containerization tools like Docker/Kubernetes is a plus.
  
**Methodologies & Tools:** Agile mindset with DevOps (CI/CD) experience, proficiency in test management systems (e.g., TestRail), and familiarity with Azure DevOps pipelines (bonus).
  
**Soft Skills:** Effective English communication for both technical and non-technical audiences, strong organizational and teamwork skills, and a proactive approach to continuous improvement.
  
**Bonus Skills:** Experience in the Alternative and Augmentative Communication (AAC) domain is a plus.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Experienced Atlassian Consultant
description:
**Introduction to Eficode**  

We are building the future of software development - specialising in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organisations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, emphasis on mental wellbeing, and a supportive, autonomous team culture.


Now, we're hiring for a talented and driven 'Experienced Atlassian Consultant' to join our Sweden team - does this sound like you? Apply today!  

  

**Role purpose**

  

As an Experienced Atlassian Consultant at Eficode, you will help clients optimize their software development and collaboration workflows using Atlassian tools like Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket. With your deep technical expertise and strategic mindset, you’ll provide tailored solutions and drive the integration of these tools with other enterprise systems, such as ServiceNow and Azure DevOps. You’ll collaborate with clients to understand their needs and implement best practices to maximize efficiency and scalability.


In this role, you will work on complex, high-impact projects alongside a team of experienced specialists, continuously learning and sharing knowledge. Your contributions will help organizations transform into agile, software-driven enterprises, while also advancing your career in a dynamic, growth-focused environment at Eficode.

 **Role responsibilities**  

*Your main responsibilities will include (but won’t be limited to):*

* Work closely with customers providing expert guidance on Atlassian product implementations and customizations
* Use your skills to tailor solutions for Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and other Atlassian products
* Lead and/or participate in complex implementations of ITSM and DevOps solutions in large and mid-sized organizations
* Design and implement integrations between Atlassian tools and other enterprise systems such as ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, or other enterprise systems
* Collaborate with a team of experienced Atlassian specialists to solve technical challenges and drive best practices for customers
* Be an Atlassian certified expert with the skills to support and implement best-in-class solutions

  

**Success factors**  

*You will make a great match for this role if you have:*

* Extensive experience as a consultant and well established apps related to the Atlassian Platform
* Technical background, with experience in scripting, automation, and/or systems integration or system development in general
* Understanding of ITIL practices or experience from ITSM organisations
* Understanding of Agile practices or ways of working
* Understanding of related tools (for instance GitHub, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket or others) and the enterprise tooling landscape as a whole
* A problem-solving mindset

A desire to continuously learn and keep up to date with the development of the Atlassian platform  
* 

  

**Desired skills and qualifications:**  

*It would be an added bonus if you have:*

* Experience working in or leading projects and technical implementations
* Understanding of the software development lifecycle
* Atlassian certifications, accreditations or badges

 **About you:**  

*The type of person we're looking for has:*

* A problem-solving mindset
* A desire to continuously learn and keep up to date with the development of the Atlassian platform
* A good team player
* An eagerness to share knowledge with peers and clients

 **What’s in it for you?**

  

* Be part of a leading DevOps and Atlassian consulting company with over 650 experts across 10 countries
* Work with exciting customers across industries and tackle complex system implementation projects
* Grow your career in a learning driven culture with opportunities for training, certifications, and knowledge sharing  

With over 90 colleagues in Sweden, we have offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö and Sundsvall. Our flexible and open work culture, focus on continuous learning, and industry leading expertise make us a great place to grow your career..

*At Eficode, we offer:*

  

* A flexible and dynamic work environment with opportunities for remote work.
* A strong learning culture, with access to certifications, training, and conferences.
* A team of driven and experienced colleagues who support and challenge each other.

A company where your expertise makes a difference – influence solutions and drive innovation.  
* 

**Location**  

This role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden and will offer a hybrid working model with a minimum of one day in the office per week.

 **DEI Statement**  

At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants. We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognise that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds, and cultures, we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.


To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information or an image of yourself in your job application.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi söker en konsult som drivs av att testa, lära, tänka nytt och påverka teamets väg framåt. Här får du vara en del av ett snabbrörligt, peppigt och öppet team där vi tillsammans formar arbetssätt och skapar långsiktiga insikter.  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Erfarenhet av Exploratory Analysis.
* Erfarenhet av DB modellering och SQL.
* Erfarenhet inom dbt.
* Erfarenhet av GCP/Big Query eller andra Cloud plattformar.
* Vilja att jobba agilt i ett tvärfunktionellt team.

  

  

**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av media eller motsvarande där stora datamängder hanteras.
* Erfarenhet av Python är positivt.
* Erfarenhet av bygga Data Pipelines och orchestration.
* Erfarenhet av AI, Machine Learning, LLM och Data Science.
* Kunskap om Continuous Delivery och DevOps.

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 17-03-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

title: .NET-konsult – Ta din karriär till nästa nivå med Nexer!
description:
Drivs du av teknik och problemlösning, men vill samtidigt ha en trygg och stabil grund att stå på? Som konsult hos oss blir du del av ett team som värdesätter både innovation och långsiktighet. Vi erbjuder en unik kombination av variation och säkerhet där du kan känna dig trygg i rollen, samtidigt som du får utforska nya utmaningar och utvecklas i din karriär.


**Om tjänsten**


 Som .NET-konsult på Nexer Göteborg får du arbeta i varierande och tekniskt utmanande uppdrag, där du är med och skapar lösningar inom Cloud, DevOps och modern systemutveckling. Vi ser till att matcha dig med uppdrag som inte bara passar din kompetens, utan också dina ambitioner. Vi tror på att konsultrollen ska vara mer än bara en placering, den ska vara en plattform för utveckling, lärande och tekniskt inflytande. Våra uppdrag är varierande och kan sträcka sig från några månader till flera år, vilket gör att du får en anställning med kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling i en föränderlig arbetsmiljö.


Att vara konsult på Nexer innebär att du får rätt uppdrag för dig. Vi har ett stort antal ramavtal som ger oss spännande och starka samarbeten med våra kunder. Hos oss finns en stark tech-community där vi delar kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi erbjuder trygghet med kollektivavtal, en företagskultur som värdesätter flexibilitet samt balans mellan arbete och fritid, och en arbetsmiljö där du blir sedd och lyssnad på. Det är också viktigt för oss att skapa en stark Nexer-anda bland våra anställda, detta gör vi genom regelbundna sociala aktiviteter och gemensam kompetensutveckling.


**Exempel på uppdrag som våra konsulter har hos oss:**

*Stabil* IoT-utveckling för fartyg: Hos en av våra kunder inom sjöfartsbranschen är vi med och skapar moderna IoT-lösningar i Azure-molnet. Med C# och .NET i backend och React för användarvänliga gränssnitt får du arbeta i ett långsiktigt projekt där vi genomför live-tester ombord på riktiga fartyg. Här får du tryggheten av ett välstrukturerat uppdrag där du kan fördjupa din tekniska kompetens i en säker miljö.


*Automation inom logistik med framtidssäkra teknologier*: Tillsammans med en internationell logistikjätte arbetar vi för att automatisera fordon och robotar med modern teknik som Docker och Kubernetes. Här används primärt C#/.NET, och vårt fokus på innovation gör att du får en trygg plattform för att utvecklas i de senaste teknikerna, samtidigt som projektet har en långsiktig vision för stabilitet.


**Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har minst fem års erfarenhet av .NET-utveckling och som är van vid att arbeta agilt tillsammans med kunder. Du trivs med att ta tekniska initiativ och bidra till lösningsarkitektur. Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift. Vi ser det även som meriterande att du har erfarenhet från att ha arbetat i projekt inom fordonsindustrin, Medtech/Life Science eller offentlig verksamhet.  



**Ansökan**


 Du ansöker genom att fylla i ansökningsformuläret nedan. Tyvärr kan vi inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post. Har du några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta vår rekryterare, Natalie Svensson, på Natalie.Svensson@nexergroup.com.


#LI-NS1

title: Senior SW Project Coordinator
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **7+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Rollbeskrivning**:


As a Project Coordinator, you will drive and organize project events and assist teams in delivering value to the larger solution/system. You will oversee execution, track feature/capability completion, and report status. You will champion continuous improvement and drive change throughout the entire solution. You will also work to remove and escalate impediments, manage risk, and ensure value delivery. You will bridge the car program project planning and the development teams delivering the software to our cars.  

  

You  

* have a clear delivery focus with the value of outcome as the main driver
* Challenge the process/es; be a part of a way forward
* Assist with decision-making by facilitating feature and capability estimation and tracking by teams
* Help manage and reduce risks, dependencies, and impediments incl. escalation
* Work with product and solution management, product owners, and other stakeholders to help ensure strategy and execution alignment

  

We believe that you have a passion for coaching teams working within embedded software systems and large-scale software development organizations. You have experience and interest in SW build and CI flow, working in an agile organization following DevOps practices and Scrum.  

  

**Required Qualifications**  

Long experience as a Project Lead on large-sized organizations.  

Leadership skills.  

Ability to lead change focusing on flow.  

Ability to drive performance and improvements.  

Experience in interpreting strategies.  

Strong communication & presentation skills.  

Planning and release experience.  

Business acumen.  

Skilled in managing Complex Software/Deliverables.  

Business driven prioritization.  

Skilled in managing stakeholder interfaces.  

Time management skills.  

Conflict management skills.  

Prior knowledge of embedded software product development and/or release.  

Fluent with both spoken and written English.  

  

**Meritorious**:  

CI/CD for Embedded Systems Basic Knowledge and understanding.  

Experience working as Release Train engineer (RTE) in a SAFe setup.**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Database Administrator
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.

 **The position**  

We are looking for someone to help establish the infrastructure behind Sweden's largest Electronic Health Record system.  

  

As a member of the IT Operations and Infrastructure team, you will be part of a team responsible for operating and maintaining the medical records system as a service to our customers. This entails focusing on the database platform and being responsible for the central operation of the databases. This includes working on critical areas such as clustering, optimization, sizing, availability, administration, and management of internal and external environments.


Cambio is a company with employees from many countries, with many cultural backgrounds and creeds. We think that you share our belief that this diversity is a key building block in creating successful teams. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.

 **About you**   

We believe your passion lies within the realm of databases. You collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, ensuring clear information flow. You solve problems based on a fact-based approach with measurability and statistics. To deliver databases as a service effectively, it's important to be proactive and meticulous, continuously improving management for long-term stability and security.




**Requirements**

  

* Five years of experience in database operations and maintenance, primarily with Microsoft SQL Server
* Experience with Always On Clustering
* Experience on database optimization and fine tuning for high performance
* Experience with scripting and automation
* Experience with monitoring
* Ability to communicate in Swedish and English




**It's a bonus if you**

* Experience with databases other than Microsoft SQL Server
* Experience with e-health system databases
* Experience with Atlassian systems ie Jira, Confluence
* Experience with database encryption
* Experience with Linux
* Knowledge of DevOps principles

 **Place of employment**: Stockholm, Linköping or remote


At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.

**Scope**: Full time

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period


**Other:** The employee will have access to sensitive data, necessitating background checks on the final candidate.
  

  

We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.


We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in **Sweden.** We will ask for verification during the process.


**We look forward to receiving your application!**


Read more about us **here!**


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site **here!**

title: Test Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Manual Testing: Support our software developers by conducting manual tests. NOTE: Manual testing is a significant part of our work, so it is essential that you have strong experience in this area.
* Automated Testing: Implement automated tests in Python in close collaboration with software developers.
* Software Verification: Test and verify the software during development and before releases.
* Hands-On Handling: Work directly with both software and hardware.
* Test Design and Execution: Design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases based on product requirements and specifications.
* Troubleshooting and Collaboration: Work closely with team members to reproduce and resolve issues.
* CI/CD Testing: Develop and maintain test pipelines for Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD).
* Transition from Manual to Automated Testing: Initially work extensively with manual testing, with the goal of transitioning to automated tests. You will be responsible for establishing the framework for this transition.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Experience: Previous experience with testing, including manual testing.
* Programming Skills: Proficiency in a high-level programming language, such as Python.
* Passion for Technology: A strong interest in technology.
* Good communication and teamwork skills.
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Experience with bug tracking tools (e.g., Jira).
* Experience with test management tools (e.g., TestRail, Zephyr).
* English proficiency: Excellent knowledge of English, both spoken and written.

  

  

**Application deadline:** 16-03-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Platform Engineer Global Platform Operations
description:
**Do you want to be a part of an elite engineering team in a fast-growing global software company?**  

  



As a Platform engineer at Outpost 24, you will work as part of a global, autonomous team ensuring continuous delivery of our market leading platform, with a continuous improvement mindset. You will play an integral part of the GPO team, managing the 24×7 offering of authentication solutions in the cloud. You will work with a team of developers, quality assurance testers, product services, support, and, of course Platform engineers.

**As a Platform Engineer within the Global Platform Operations team your responsibilities will be:**

* Deploy, support, and manage new releases
* Automate and improve the Specops continuous delivery process
* Research and implement new tools and technologies
* Ensure up-time and service reliability
* Maintain security best practices
* Monitor and improve performance

**What type of experience do we expect from our ideal candidate?**

  

* 3+ years working as a software developer in a CI/CD and DevOps environment
* Experience working with business critical systems
* Real-life Azure and/or AWS experience
* Designing and automating workflows and processes

**What skills do we require from an ideal candidate?**

**Required:**

  

* Strong scripting skills, preferably using PowerShell
* Continuous delivery - Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy or similar.
* Server/application monitoring/logging
* Databases in general, and Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, Elasticsearch
* Verbal and written technical communication skills in English

**Desirable:**

* Experience writing code - C# .NET
* Windows server/Active directory management
* Linux administration
* Container technologies (docker etc.)
* Networking
* Virtualization

**But** **what’s in it for you?**


In return for your efforts, we can offer you:

* A flat organizational structure and lots of autonomy; you are not just a number.
* An organizational culture founded on trust, respect, adaptability, and commitment, where your personal and professional development will be emphasized.
* Work with a fun and distributed team across the world.
* A healthy work-life balance, so you can enjoy flexible work hours and a hybrid working environment if desired.
* A good compensation package.
* Local benefits depending on where you are located
* An opportunity to develop your career in an international growing company
* And last but definitely not least, just some fantastic teammates and a fun place to work!

**And so much more!**

**At Outpost24, we're dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, where attitude, values and willingness to learn are valued above all. So, if you're excited about this role but your professional experiences don't completely align with what we're looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!**

*As part of the recruitment process, you must be able to pass a background check to qualify for this position.*

title: Senior AWS Plattform Engineer
description:

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Designa, utveckla och underhålla en modern och effektiv plattform för hantering av storskalig produktionsdata. Implementera lösningar för spårbarhet, kvalitetssäkring och operativ effektivitet genom integration av molnteknologier, mikrotjänster och CI/CD-processer.  

Automatisera och optimera utvecklingsarbetsflöden för att möjliggöra snabba och säkra driftsättningar. * Kunskap om Kubernetes och containerbaserade applikationer.
