title: Digital Transformation Lead
description:
*BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. In fact, our market share is higher than all our competitors’ combined. Today, we manufacture close to 2,000 spreaders of all types every year and our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports world- wide.*  

  

*BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.*  

  

*More information about BROMMA can be found on* *www.bromma.com*

**About Bromma**

  

Bromma is the industry’s most experienced spreader manufacturer, recognized globally for crane spreaders known for their exceptional reliability. Since the 1960s, over 20,000 crane spreaders and rotators have been put into service. Today, Bromma manufactures nearly 2,000 spreaders of various types annually. In fact, anywhere you go, if you work in container handling, you are likely to see a Bromma spreader in action. Learn more at www.bromma.com.

 **Make Your Next Move Count**

  

Are you a driven and innovative digital transformation professional with a passion for technology? If so, this role at Bromma could be your next career move!

  

We are looking for a Digital Transformation Architect to join our team in Kista, Stockholm. In this role, you will lead the digitalization of the cargo handling industry by defining and executing Bromma’s digital strategy. You will play a key role in shaping our enterprise information management (IM) landscape while driving transformation initiatives to enhance our operations.

 **What You’ll Do**

  

As a Digital Transformation Architect at Bromma, you will work closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to:

* Develop and execute Bromma’s IM architecture strategy across the entire digital landscape
* Lead major technology transitions, including a global ERP modernization, enhancements to service delivery tools, and process improvements
* Own Bromma’s data and analytics strategy, with a focus on Google Cloud Platform products (e.g., Data Studio, Connected Sheets), including hands-on development of new capabilities
* Improve Bromma’s data models and drive increased integration across platforms and processes
* Implement and optimize AI-driven capabilities to enhance business operations
* Work with a diverse technology stack, including SAP, Hybris eCommerce, Salesforce, Tacton CPQ, Jira Service Desk, and various custom and legacy applications.

 **Why Join Bromma?**

  

At Bromma, we believe in our people—our team is what truly makes the difference. We foster a collaborative culture, working closely with customers, keeping our promises, and tackling challenges together. We want everyone to feel valued and free to be themselves because your uniqueness is your strength. At Bromma, you belong.

  

Joining us means:

* Being part of an international, innovative environment where you can grow and thrive
* Working with great colleagues from diverse backgrounds who share ambitious goals
* Contributing to the future of digitalization in the cargo handling industry.

 **What You’ll Need to Succeed**

  

We are looking for a candidate with significant experience leading digital transformation in large, international enterprises. The ideal candidate will have:Extensive experience in IM architecture and digitalization strategy.

* Background in IT environments within industrial manufacturing companies
* Broad expertise in enterprise applications and hands-on analytics development (especially Google Analytics and Google Workspace tools)
* Proven track record in IT project management and Agile project delivery methods
* A MSc or BSc degree in Engineering or a related field
* Fluency in Swedish and English (English is our corporate language).

 **Additional Information**

  

We believe diversity drives innovation and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, including women in technology and individuals from diverse backgrounds.

  

We support hybrid work arrangements, offering flexibility to balance office and remote work.

  

For more information, please contact Joakim Heijbel, Director Digitalisation and Sustainability, via email: joakim.heijbel@bromma.com.

  

If this opportunity excites you, apply by [XX.XX.XXXX]. Interviews may begin before the closing date, so we encourage early applications.

  

Bromma is part of Kalmar Solutions. Learn more at www.kalmarglobal.com.

*Bromma is part of Kalmar.*

***About Kalmar***  

*Kalmar (Nasdaq Helsinki: KALMAR) is moving goods in critical supply chains around the world, with the vision to be the forerunner in sustainable material handling equipment and services. The company offers a wide range of industry shaping heavy material handling equipment and services to ports and terminals, distribution centres, manufacturing and heavy logistics. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Kalmar operates globally in over 120 countries and employs approximately 5,200 people. In 2024, the company's sales totalled approximately EUR 1.7 billion. www.kalmarglobal.com*
company_description: Kalmar is the industry forerunner in terminal automation and in energy efficient container handling, with one in four container movements around the globe being handled by a Kalmar solution.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
Discover Trend
Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fueled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organizations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defense techniques optimized for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organizations to simplify and secure their connected world. For additional information, visit www.trendmicro.com
Discover You  

At Trend, we are always looking for top talent. We hire capability 1st, and you will work with the best. When you join us, you have direct access to any level, and freedom to make an impact and influence. With Trend Micro, you drive your own development. You are recognised for your passion to succeed, and can be the best part of yourself here.  

  

Discover your next exciting career opportunity….
Sales Engineer
Location: Stockholm, Sweden
Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fueled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, our unified cybersecurity platform protects over 500,000 organizations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints.
Trend Vision One™ delivers advanced threat defense techniques, extended detection and response (XDR), and integration across the IT ecosystem, including AWS, Microsoft, and Google, enabling organizations to better understand, communicate, and mitigate cyber risk.
Our Trend global threat research team delivers unparalleled intelligence and insights that power our cybersecurity platform and help protect organizations around the world from 100s of millions of threats daily.
We have 7,000 employees across 65 countries, singularly focused on security and passionate about making the world a safer and better place.
Trend enables organizations to simplify and secure their connected world.
Overview:
The Sales Engineer (SE) will be the technical bridge between our Sales Representatives and their pre-sales customers. The SE will take ownership of the prime technical relationship with our pre-sales customers to help close business by proactively managing and delivering technical information to our customers both onsite, online, and via telephone.
Responsibilities:* Provide solutions to complex technical issues in the pre-sales capacity
* Provide Proof of Concept service to pre-sales customers and help clients with planning and implementation of Trend Micro software products
* Work in a fast-paced environment under minimal supervision to provide detailed technical knowledge of Trend Micro software products in the pre-sales context
* Deliver detailed technical demos of Trend Cloud Solutions and integrations with key cloud services in AWS, Azure, and GCP.
* Proactively own technical relationships with customers and prospects while engaging internal Sales, Channel, and Partner Managers as needed.
* Have the ability to solve complex cloud and security designs
* Participate in alliance projects including building vendor and customers relationships
* Participate in Trend Micro beta testing programs including internally testing products in alpha and beta phase
* Share best practices with other SEs to enhance the quality and efficiency of the other members
* Contribute to building the SE Readiness Program and develop Subject Matter Expertise in assigned products and solutions
* Must be able to travel regionally (about 30-35%) and perform sales presentations, marketing and user group events, and emergency on-site support to customer locations


Qualifications:* We are looking for a candidate with drive, enthusiasm, with a strong work ethic & a desire to learn and develop their career within cyber security!
* If you are early in your career path, but have great experience within Cyber Security as an architect, developer, network or systems engineer, or similar, but interested in growing and developing a career in Sales Engineering, then we would love to hear from you!
* We are also taking applications from more experienced Sales Engineers or Security Specialists who have:
* 3+ years SE experience and/or professional services experience
* 3+ years’ experience in computer software or systems including security products (firewalls, antivirus, intrusion detection, content security)
* Experience working with multi-cloud environments such AWS, Azure or GCP
* 2+ years SOC or IR Experience an advantage


Desirable Experience:* Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) Certification
* CompTIA Security+ Certification
* Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP)
* Experience and understanding of Cloud architectures. AWS Certifications are preferred.
* Basic understanding of security incidents, network administration and management of security solutions including endpoint/server, web filtering, email filtering and IPS
* Experience with Python, PowerShell, Bash
* Ability to manage own time effectively is a requirement for success
* Quick learner with desire to learn new tools and techniques
* Strong verbal and written communication, customer service, account management and negotiation skills, with the ability to interface with a diverse set of clients


Why Trend Micro?
Trend Micro provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Trend Micro does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.
Trend Micro is a progressive employer with a very special and unique culture. Here at Trend Micro you will work with the best. When you join us, you have direct access to any level, and freedom to make an impact and influence. We expect leadership, not management. With Trend Micro, you drive your own development. We encourage thought leadership and advocate internal opportunity. Trend is like nowhere else. We embrace all of our differences and are motivated by challenge. We’re not just all about the money. You are recognised for your passion to succeed, and can be the best part of yourself here. #LI-DNI
www.trendmicro.com
At Trend Micro, we embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation in a connected world. Our diversity and multicultural workforce are key contributing factors to our success across the globe. We like to have fun while taking our culture seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to this regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, nationality, age, citizenship, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or veteran status. We do not allow discrimination or harassment of any kind.

title: Inhouse Sales Agent
description:
Scandic Group & Meeting Sverige är Scandics Inhouse Sales avdelning där vi hanterar alla grupp - och mötesaffärer för våra hotell i Sverige.


Vi tar hand om och är med kunden hela vägen från offertförfrågan fram till deras ankomst samt följer upp och hanterar faktureringen efter avresan.


Med hög energi, bra samarbete och en riktig ”nu kör vi” anda arbetar vi för att erbjuda en bekymmersfri kundresa i världsklass och leverera bästa möjliga service till våra gäster.


**Vi behöver nu stärka upp med nya, härliga kollegor till vårat koordineringskontor i Malmö och söker efter engagerade Inhouse Sales Agents som brinner för affären och service!**


**Nu söker vi efter dig som vill vara med och koordinera sportgrupper för utvalda hotell i södra och mellersta Sverige.**

Sporten är ett viktigt och stort segment för Scandic och innefattar allt från mindre grupper på 15 personer till stora cuper, mästerskap och landslagsbokningar.


Du är gästens primära kontaktperson från och med att bokningen bekräftas och ansvarar för att detaljplanera hela bokningen inklusive fakturering och uppföljning av genomförandet tillsammans med kund.



Du, ditt team och din Inhouse Sales Manager jobbar nära och tillsammans med era fokushotell.



Som Inhouse Sales Agent behöver du vara lyhörd, noggrann och ha en vilja att leverera service på högsta nivå. Du är kreativ, drivs av försäljning, har ett positivt bemötande gentemot kollegor och kunder och har lätt för att samarbeta. Vi vill att du är modig, tar initiativ samt vågar komma med nya förslag och idéer. Att du brinner för goda kundrelationer och att din kommunikativa förmåga är på topp ser vi som en självklarhet.



Du ansvarar för att din prestation medverkar till att teamet når sina mål och att kunderna upplever fantastisk service. Du och ditt team bidrar starkt till att kunderna återvänder till oss på Scandic.



Vi vill att du tar med dig din kultur och erfarenheter för att tillsammans med dina kollegor bidra till att inspirera och utveckla Scandic Group & Meeting.


Att du både pratar och skriver flytande på Svenska och Engelska är ett krav. Tidigare erfarenhet av liknande arbete, Scandic och kunskaper i Opera Cloud är starkt meriterande. För denna roll är även erfarenhet av hotelldrift och koordiering av stor vikt.


Vi sitter på vårat nya kontor på Kaptensgatan 1 och arbetstiden är fördelad mellan 8.00-17.00 på vardagar. Helger och kvällar kan förekomma.


Tjänsten är ett vikariat på ungefär ett år med start så snart som möjligt.


Inom Scandic hotels finns stora möjligheter till vidareutveckling efter avslutat vikariat, antingen hos oss på Scandic Group & Meeting eller på något av våra hotell.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kommer tillsättas så snart som möjligt, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt.


Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic Group & Meeting!


  
Det här är en anställning med vikariat på heltid.


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: SAP Finance Lead Sweden
description:
Do you have a passion for leading the transformation of the finance function with the newest SAP technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your extensive business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Finance Lead in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!


Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to leverage your extensive experience and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**


Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.


Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP, and SAP RISE.


We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.


To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at *An external link was removed to protect your privacy.*.

**What’s in it for you:**

* Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.
* Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.
* Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.
* Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.
* Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry-leading add-on software, expert network, and benchmarks.
* Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.
* Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP Finance and other areas by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.
* Utilize your industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.
* Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network for collaboration and delivery.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.
* Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.
* Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Finance Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**SAP Finance Nordic Value Tower**


Curious colleagues working within SAP Finance - We are a fantastic and diverse Nordic team consisting of around 80 colleagues in 4 countries, and we are growing steadily.

**What do we do?**


Accenture provides a full range of SAP-based services and solutions for the Finance organization leveraging SAP Financials, which provides a complete financial management solution for a broad range of industries. SAP Financials is the leading enterprise software solution for accounting, financial reporting, performance management, and corporate governance.


Our SAP Financials solution helps clients leverage the full range of SAP functionality for finance transformation. These SAP capabilities center around six key components:

* Financial Accounting & Operations (covering FI module, Real Estate, and Travel Management) Optimize our client's accounting processes based on the implementation and/or the upgrade of the SAP FI module.
* Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) (covering CO module and SEM / Business Objects) Ensures that our clients can significantly measure and drive value from the planning and control cycle.
* Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Financials Optimize our client's investment, project, and asset management processes.
* Treasury and Financial Supply Chain Management (FSCM) Significantly improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our client's treasury operations, safeguard their liquidity, and ensure that financial risks are both identified and effectively managed.
* Industry-Specific Financials Implement specialized SAP functionality to support clients in industries with highly specialized financial accounting and processing requirements such as insurance, utilities, and the public sector.
* Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Combines profit-driven business concepts with new SAP technology to increase compliance efficiency and bring profitable insights into core business processes.

  

**Qualifications**

* Min. 10+ years of SAP experience in an onshore project role (preferably in the Nordics).
* Extensive hands-on Finance experience from SAP ECC and S/4HANA Finance solutions.
* Experience in leading SAP Finance/Controlling projects (stand alone or as part of a larger SAP program)
* Experience of the full lifecycle including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end.
* Deep business & industry experience in one or more industries.
* Deep understanding of Finance processes and their business value drivers.
* Strong resonance with Accenture values.
* Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies.
* Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment.
* Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence.
* Passionate about SAP, innovation, and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients.
* Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment.
* Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player.
* Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English.
* Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner.

title: QA Engineer - EU citizen to realocate to Malmö (Sweden)
description:
Boost IT is looking for highly motivated QA engineer who will be responsible for the delivery and execution of tests on web for one of our clients. The ideal candidate will have in-depth knowledge of core web technologies, a solid understanding of how web browsers work, programming expertise, and proficiency with web developer tools for various browsers.
  
  

**Location:** Malmö (5 days onsite)
  
  

**Contract:** B2B (Contractor)
  
  

Tasks
  
  

This role encompasses a diverse set of responsibilities which includes enhancing current testing infrastructure and validating builds and deployments for maps on web releases. You’ll also work closely with the development team to design and implement new tools, in order to continuously improve both the quality of the product and the processes of the team.
  
  

This is a hands-on role for someone who enjoys taking initiative and is comfortable working with cross functional teams. The person filling this position must be a proactive, self-motivated test developer with great communication skills and a desire to succeed in a challenging and fast-paced environment.
  
  

It is a team that conceptualizes, iterates, and executes new features on an ongoing basis.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

* Hands-on experience with testing large scale web applications, along with analytical thinking to build clear, concise, and comprehensive test scenarios and test plans
* Excellent problem-solving and analytics skills, with the ability to investigate, debug and triage difficult problems both independently and cooperatively.
* Practical experience with Web technologies, such as HTML/CSS/JavaScript, JavaScript test frameworks (e.g. MochaJS, Cypress, Playwright), Chai, Node.js
* Knowledge of software development tools like svn, git, bash, make, and Xcode.
* Some familiarity with containerization environment (Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud environment (AWS or GCP).
* Strong Automation skills and CI/CD pipeline experience
* Experience in Agile software development methodologies/Scrum and rapid releases.
* Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skills.


**Additional Requirements:**  

Knowledge of one or more of these areas would be valuable but not required:
  
  

* Understanding of network security fundamentals / security testing / privacy
* Performance testing
* Experience with Python scripting language


**Education:**  

Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience.

title: Senior Embedded Engineer
description:
Senior Embedded Engineer

  

Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: Sweden


Expected Start date: ASAP


Job Name: Senior Software Engineer (Powertrain)


We are seeking several talented Embedded Software Developers to join our external development team. As part of this team, the resources will work on day-to-day tasks in our product, following the same agile practices as our internal teams. The role will involve developing, testing, and integrating software changes to enhance the performance and functionality of internal combustion engine systems.  

  

Key Responsibilities:  

• Develop embedded software in C and Python, adhering to MISRA standards.  

• Create and manage documentation and set requirements effectively.  

• Perform unit testing, integration testing, digital verification, and system verification.  

• Collaborate with team members to resolve uncertainties, blockers, and dependencies.  

• Participate in agile events such as PI-planning and Retrospective meetings.  

• Demonstrate and hand over work to corresponding teams, ensuring high-quality delivery.  

  

Qualifications:  

• Experience from Automotive industry is a must  

• Proficiency in embedded software development, including MISRA standards.  

• Strong knowledge of C and Python, with experience in hand-coded C.  

• Experience in documentation, requirement setting, and various testing methods.  

• Familiarity with best practices in software development and testing.  

• **Highly Important: Experience in powertrain development.**  

• Experience in the automotive industry and/or with internal combustion engines is a merit but not mandatory.  

• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


  
Job Overview


* Location : Stockholm, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : C/C++, MISRA, Powertrain, Python

title: Product Manager - Engineering - Market Data - Stockholm - Associate
company_industry: Banks And Financial Services, Banks And Financial Services
description:
**YOUR IMPACT**

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our Market Data Engineering team. Market Data is the lifeblood of Goldman Sachs, our products and services are critical in delivering commercial success for the firm. The Product Manager will be a key member of the Market Data Engineering team, responsible for defining, prioritizing, and delivering the product roadmap for our real-time market data platforms. The successful candidate will work closely with our internal business clients, the market data engineering and other teams across data engineering to ensure the successful delivery of high-quality, reliable, and scalable market data solutions.  



Our #1 business principle is "Our clients' interests always come first. Our experience shows that if we serve our clients well, our own success will follow". Every customer is given maximum attention to understand their needs. We adopt the most appropriate approach to drive the business of the customer or institution towards the desired growth. We apply the same approach to the way we build products and deliver customer-centric, world class products through the collaborative work with our business clients.  



We are looking for an experienced product manager familiar with product development and management who has a proven track record in leading the delivery of impactful platforms from inception to completion. The ideal candidate will be excited by solving customer problems, about working with end users to specify requirements and elicit feedback, and leading build and execution. We are looking for a talented and passionate Product Manager who thrives in an extremely entrepreneurial, fast paced environment. This is a high visibility role, backed by some of the senior-most leaders of the firm, and as such, will require creativity and drive to deliver on an ambitious roadmap.  



**HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL**

You will be an experienced Product Manager, working cross-functionally to guide products from conception through launch, growth and maturity by connecting technical and business domains to meet our customer needs. You will break down complex problems into steps that drive product development and release, adopting the principals of early releases and incremental deliveries to generate evidence of customer value.


As a Data Product Manager in Market Data Engineering, you will:


* Product Strategy & Roadmap: Define and maintain a clear product vision, strategy, and roadmap aligned with the overall business objectives. This includes conducting market research, analyzing competitive landscapes, and identifying opportunities for innovation and improvement.
* Contribute to one of the most critical Engineering functions at Goldman Sachs.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across different departments and levels of the organization. Effectively communicate product updates and progress.
* Partner with businesses to model their processes and capture their data requirements to drive insights and commercialization.
* Shape the standards and policies within the firmwide Product Management function.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to design, develop, and launch new features and products. Ensure that products meet the defined requirements and are delivered on time and within budget.
* Apply a data-driven mindset to create and use analytics to decide what features should be prioritized and why, as well as predict issues before they occur.
Understand business use cases so that you can influence and drive their prioritization and ensure the data platform is developed with the right fit-for-purpose.  
* 

  

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor's in a technical/ business degree or equivalent practical experience
* 2-5 years of product and/or technical program management experience in a client facing role
* Demonstrated success collaborating with design and engineering teams to drive product development
* Comfortable with Agile processes, with an emphasis on creating backlogs that support the product roadmap
* Proven ability to influence and/or lead a cross-functional team without direct authority
* Demonstrated ability to communicate complex problems and roadmaps to stakeholders
* Ability to engage with and influence stakeholders outside their direct control
* Proven ability to lead by example, with a positive attitude
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to set goals, meet deadlines and effectively communicate progress to stakeholders
* Independent thinker, willing to engage, challenge or learn
* Ability to stay commercially focused and to always push for quantifiable commercial impact
* A healthy obsession on customer satisfaction and the customer experience, and a willingness to be its internal advocate
Strong work ethic, a sense of ownership and urgency  
* 

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Bachelor’s/Master’s/MBA in related fields
* Experience managing an entire product's lifecycle, from conception to launch
* Familiarity with JIRA, GitLab, GitHub
* Familiarity with Design Thinking, Working Backwards Process, and OKR concepts
* Understanding of market data technologies, including data feeds, data distribution architectures, and data storage solutions.
Familiarity with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, GCP, OCI) is highly desirable.  
* 

Who We Look For


Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.  



ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS  

  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.  

  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.  

  

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html  

  

  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veterans status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Vikarierande Art Director till Insert Media
description:
Vår Art Director ska gå på föräldraledighet, och vi söker nu en skicklig Art Director och grafisk formgivare som kan ta över arbetsuppgifterna under denna period. Insert Media befinner sig i en spännande utvecklingsfas, och vi söker därför en flexibel person som är öppen för varierande arbetsuppgifter och redo att bidra med sin kreativa kompetens!

**Om rollen**  
I din primära roll som Art Director ansvarar du för att formge och skapa layout för våra temabilagor – både i print och online. Du tar fram kreativa lösningar för olika teman och arbetar med hela processen från idé till färdigt material för tryck och digital publicering. Du arbetar tätt tillsammans med vår redaktör och har ett övergripande ansvar för tidningens layout och visuella uttryck.

Utöver tidningsproduktionen kommer du även att samarbeta med vår säljavdelning för att hjälpa kunder att få ut det bästa av sin annonsering. Dessutom kan produktion av annat grafiskt material för interna ändamål förekomma.

Som en del av din tjänst kommer du även att arbeta med andra grafiska uppdrag, exempelvis skapa grafiska manualer och bistå i framtagning av presentationer.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har gedigen erfarenhet som Art Director och en portfölj som visar din designkompetens.
* Behärskar Adobe Creative Cloud, särskilt InDesign, Photoshop och Illustrator.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med trycksaker och förståelse för tryckprocessens krav.
* Har en stark känsla för layout, typografi och design.
* Är noggrann, strukturerad och har förmåga att hålla deadlines.
* Är nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker och inte rädd för att ta dig an utmaningar.
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
* Har en positiv inställning och ett flexibelt arbetssätt.

**Vad vi erbjuder:**

* En roll med varierande arbetsuppgifter som kombinerar design och redaktionellt arbete.
* Möjligheten att arbeta med välkända format och nå ut till en bred publik.
* Ett kreativt och engagerat team med lång erfarenhet i branschen.
* En arbetsplats där nya idéer och initiativ alltid välkomnas.

**Ansökan**  
Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan! Skicka med ett personligt brev och ditt portfolio så vi kan se vad du gjort tidigare. Vikariatet startar i början av augusti och intervjuer sker löpande, så vänta inte för länge med att söka.

**Välkommen till Insert Media – där vi skapar innehåll som inspirerar och engagerar!**

title: Sales Executive - NORDICs
description:
Do you have direct consultative sales experience for products, solutions or software within Clinical, Genomic or Molecular Diagnostics, or the NGS Workflow? Have you built a network amongst clinical institutions, diagnostics and healthcare?


If this sounds like you and you are driven by purpose, Join the SOPHiA GENETICS Northern Europe Sales Team Team as a Sales Executive for the NORDICs and enable us to make a positive impact on the outcomes for cancer and rare disease patients worldwide.


This is a field based role, responsible for Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Iceland. You can be based in any of these countries, as long as you are able to travel freely and easily amongst the others. You will spend you time working from home-office, or travelling across your territory for customer meeting, conferences and events. (Travel expected 50-75%)

 **Our Mission:**


We believe there is a smarter, more data-driven way to make decisions in healthcare and our cloud-native AI powered SOPHiA DDM Platform makes that vision a reality on a daily basis. You will have direct input to our mission to democratize data-driven medicine for the ultimate benefit of cancer and rare disease patients across the globe.

 **Your Mission:**


Reporting to the Senior Manager, Regional Sales, you will have full autonomy over your territory and be responsible for generating revenue through new logos and expanding existing relationships.

**The Value you add**

* Prospecting, pitching and driving business development.
* Drive consistent momentum in sales cycles and maintain a healthy sales pipeline
* Drive business growth through expanding our market share within current accounts and finding new opportunities to extend our relationship with them
* Advise the company and guide product management on market & product requirements

**Requirements**

**The experience you bring:**

* 3-5 Years minimum consultative sales experience within healthcare and life sciences, with an established network across the NORDIC Healthcare systems and pathology markets
* Direct Experience selling NGS, Genomic or similar diagnostic workflow products into Hospital Systems and/or Lab Environments
* A hunter mentality, driven by a desire to consistently generate new business

As a public organisation facing ongoing commercial growth, you will bring a success-orientated and solutions-focused mindset that embraces team collaborations, change, growth and inclusion.

 **As an international organisation, English is our primary business language and as part of your recruitment journey, you should expect to meet English-only speakers. For best chances of success, you should include your CV in English. Unfortunately, non-English CVs have a high likelihood of being rejected at application stage.**

**Benefits**


You will be joining an organisation with the patient at the heart of every decision and action, driven by purpose as we pursue exponential growth.

  

* Business recognition and accolades include:
* World's most innovative companies (Top 10)
* World's smartest companies (Top 50)
* 100 Best Places to Work in Boston
* Top 10 European Tech Startup
* Top 10 European biotechs startup to watch
* Top 25 East-Coast Biotech to watch

  



An exciting company mission that brings together science and technology to directly impact the lives of patients with life-threatening illness.

At the centre of our Virtues is our Mantra, We Care, which provides a constant reminder of the compassionate, benevolent, and hopeful nature of our mission and how it should be threaded through each of our Virtues and everything we do. Learn more about our DNA and Virtues on our Careers portal

If this sounds like you and you are driven by purpose, Join the SOPHiA GENETICS Northern Europe Sales Team Team as a Sales Executive for the NORDICs and enable us to make a positive impact on the outcomes for cancer and rare disease patients worldwide.


This is a field based role, responsible for Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Iceland. You can be based in any of these countries, as long as you are able to travel freely and easily amongst the others. You will spend you time working from home-office, or travelling across your territory for customer meeting, conferences and events. (Travel expected 50-75%)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
The worldwide data management software market is massive (According to IDC, the worldwide database software market, which it refers to as the database management systems software market, was forecasted to be approximately $82 billion in 2023 growing to approximately $137 billion in 2027. This represents a 14% compound annual growth rate). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.



The Infrastructure Engineering team is responsible for building and maintaining a self-service internal development platform that enables MongoDB engineering teams to reliably deploy and operate their own production services and products. We work with numerous engineering teams across the company to understand their infrastructure requirements and development workflows, develop broadly applicable self-service platform services and tooling, continuously monitor how platform services are being utilized, and look for ways to improve developer productivity through automation and education.



We are big open source enthusiasts and use a number of open source tools in our stack (contributing upstream whenever possible). Some of the tools we use regularly include Go, AWS, Kubernetes, Crossplane, Terraform, Helm, Drone, Prometheus, and Grafana. However, technology is nothing without a stellar team of engineers that are focused on doing high quality work and working as a team to solve complex distributed computing and platform engineering problems. This is where you come in!



This role can be based out of our Dublin office or fully remote within the following countries: Ireland, UK, Sweden, the Netherlands, Germany, Spain, Bulgaria, Denmark, Finland, France, Italy, & Poland.


### **Our ideal candidate**


* Pragmatic, detail-oriented, self-motivated, and understands the benefits of collaboration
* Takes a software-driven approach to solving problems and routinely uses git to track progress
* Familiar with software engineering principles, dependency injection, composition, and test driven development
* Experience designing/implementing medium/large scale software projects (preferably with Go)
* Familiar with standard authentication protocols (e.g OAuth)
* Familiar with the development of web services and/or Kubernetes controllers
* Experienced performing deep technical analysis and fixing applications, systems, and networks
* Experience working with Linux, command line, and TCP/IP networking skills
* Experience working with container runtime toolchains (containerd, docker, podman)
* Solid knowledge of cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS)
* Experience with configuration management tools and managing infrastructure through code
* Familiar with how to use CI/CD workflows and tooling to deploy production services
* Experience running containers in a production environment, preferably Kubernetes based
* Experience with observability concepts and tooling, metrics, logging, traces, Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry
* Has practical knowledge of delivering production level services with SLI/SLOs and understands how to measure, track and adjust them
* 2-5 years of experience working in a similar role

### **Position Expectations**


* Work with engineering teams across MongoDB to investigate gaps and limitations in existing development workflows and understand new infrastructure and platform requirements
* Design self-service platform services and developer tooling that focuses on reliability, usability, and provides the appropriate level of abstraction from cloud infrastructure
* Regularly write and review automation, configuration management, and application code
* Author and review functional specifications and scoping documents for large platform projects and services
* Own and operate much of the internal development platform that runs MongoDB
* Work on a distributed team that frequently interacts with remote engineers across multiple time zones (primarily PST/EST/GMT)

### **Success Measures**


* In three months you'll have familiarized yourself with much of our environment and will be able to whiteboard important pieces of our platform on the fly. You will also be making regular contributions to our tooling/services and jumping in to help resolve incidents and respond to user requests
* In six months you'll have successfully investigated, scoped, executed, and documented a medium to large sized platform project
* In a year you'll have used your deep knowledge of our software and infrastructure to help drive platform adoption across the company. You will also be a subject matter expert in at least one component of our platform, and will have made a number of sizable contributions to our code base that significantly improve the quality, reliability and maintainability of our systems


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we're committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees' wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it's like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!



MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.



MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Senior Cloud Security Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Cloud Security Engineer to join our growing security team. You will be part of our cybersecurity group which is committed to building a strong security foundation across Vizrt. In your role as the senior cloud security engineer, you will have the opportunity and responsibility to shape Vizrt's cloud journey while making sure we are following the highest security standards in this area.


What You’ll Do:


* Design, implement, and enhance cloud security controls across AWS and Azure.
* Identify and mitigate cloud security risks, ensuring compliance with industry standards.
* Integrate current security tooling and identify potential gaps in our cloud security controls.
* Collaborate with RnD teams to embed security best practices into cloud infrastructure.
* Lead incident response efforts related to cloud security threats and misconfigurations.
* Work with internal stakeholders to define and enforce security policies.
* Own and drive cloud security initiatives across AWS and Azure.
* Develop automation and security tooling to reduce manual effort to strengthen cloud security.
* Stay ahead of emerging cloud security threats and drive proactive risk mitigation strategies.

**Requirements**

* 5+ years of experience in cloud security, with hands-on expertise in mainly AWS plus Azure.
* Strong understanding of identity & access management, network security, and cloud-native security tools.
* Cloud security certifications are appreciated, but are not mandatory. It is an extra bonus if you have experience with hands-on penetration testing of cloud environments.
* Experience with security automation, SIEM, and threat detection in cloud environments.
* Familiarity with IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation) and CI/CD security practices.
* Ability to work independently in a remote environment and drive security initiatives.
* Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive security mindset.

**Benefits**


We offer an exciting position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Vizrt;'s.

* Work-Life balance as it plays an important role in generating long-lasting productivity and output.
* A workplace that believes strength is found in diversity.
* Rewards - you will enjoy flexible working hours, competitive remuneration, an attractive pension package, health care insurance, wellness allowance, and other benefits
* The stories we tell are unique. We'd love to hear yours.

### **Recruitment Process**

* Recruiter Screening
* Team Interview
* Technical Discussion
* Final Interview

title: QA Specialist
description:
**Xensam:** SAM Disrupters Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
  
We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
  
About the role As our Quality Assurance Specialist, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our SaaS application, inventory agent, and connectors. You'll be deeply involved in hands-on testing, taking ownership of the QA process, and collaborating closely with our outsourced testing team.
  
Responsibilities
  
Work closely with a team of QA professionals to ensure high-quality software delivery.
  
Develop and implement QA strategies, processes, and standards to meet quality objectives.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define testing requirements and priorities.
  
Conduct test planning, execution, and reporting to ensure product quality meets expectations.
  
Do manual testing, work with test automation, integration testing, and end-to-end testing.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Proven experience of 2-3 years in QA roles with a focus on software testing and quality assurance.
  
Strong understanding of QA methodologies, tools, and best practices in an Agile environment.
  
Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
  
Strong proficiency in written and spoken English, and preferably Swedish.
  
Strategic thinker with a proactive approach to problem-solving and decision-making.
  
Experience in writing automation and integration tests, including database testing.
  
  

What you get
  
A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  
A generous work culture with free access to drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
  
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  
Other location-specific benefits.
  
  

**At Xensam, our core values define our culture:**  

**Rebellious:** We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
  
**Humane:** We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
  
**Harmonious:** We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
  
  

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!
  
As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Quantitative Analyst
description:
Kambi are looking for a highly motivated and experienced self-starter to join our quantitative analysis team in central Stockholm. For the right candidate, the position will provide the opportunity to research and develop cutting-edge algorithmic solutions to support our B2B Sportsbook operations. You will take a leading role in cross-functional teams, building complete trading solutions, and where your main responsibility will be to develop and maintain sport models. You will report to the Head of Quantitative Analytics.
  
  

**Main responsibilities:**  

Support and work in close collaboration with trading, risk and other areas of the business by providing algorithmic solutions
  
Responsible for the end-to-end process of algorithm development, from inception to deployment as well as maintenance
  
Analysis and interpretation of data to produce meaningful information, in particular changes in patterns and trends
  
Communicate results and ideas to stakeholders
  
  

**Skills and experience:**  

An academic degree in a quantitative discipline (computer science, mathematics, physics, etc.)
  
Previous experience in a similar role designing predictive models for real-world business problems
  
Advanced knowledge of stochastic processes, mathematical methods and probability theory
  
Proficiency with C/C++ and Python, in particular having worked in software teams (git) is a plus
  
Experience using statistical and query computer languages (R/SQL) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  
Experience with cloud computing (AWS) is a plus
  
  

**The successful candidate has:**  

Creative and experimental mindset to data mining
  
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development
  
A drive to promote innovative algorithmic solutions and data driven decision-making
  
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate to both business and technical minded colleagues
  
Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities
  
  

What's in it for you?
  
Opportunity to work in a fast-growing industry
  
A role within a highly ambitious team
  
Support for personal development
  
A fun and flexible working culture
  
  

We are curious about your story, if you are interested in meeting us please apply with your CV.

description:

Continuous Service Manager- Tietoevry Industry (m/f/d)
We are searching for a solution-sales oriented person to join an exciting growth initiative. You will be working with existing customers and sales cases throughout the Nordics. Nexus helps businesses manage liquidity, information exchange and Data as part of their industry-specific eco-systems. We have five service areas: Industry Messaging, Billing & Invoice, and Data Services.
For this position, you will work with Purchase to pay, order to cash, e-invoice services and other digital solutions that are represented in Industry Messaging and Billing & Invoice.
Being one of the largest messaging providers in the Nordic region we can give you the opportunity to work with some of the most demanding and interesting customers on the market. You will be working with some of the most experienced people in our field, covering areas such as supply chain, logistics, financial and energy messaging. This is an opportunity to develop yourself within our organization and make a difference.
When joining Tietoevry Industry as a Continuous Service Manager* You will work close to the product team and be able to influence product development.
* Manage the existing customers through the contract's life cycle.
* You will be accountable for delivering according to contract and SLA’s, driving up-sales and developing existing customers.

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about solving technical challenges and helping customers? Smartoptics is looking for a Technical Support Engineer to join our team in Kista. In this role, you’ll provide top-tier support for our advanced optical networking solutions, working closely with customers and internal teams to ensure seamless operations.



**Introduction**
----------------



Smartoptics provides advanced optical networking solutions for modern open networks. We help customers solve network challenges and stay competitive. Our customers include telecom and cable operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, government agencies, and businesses of all sizes.



If you join this role, you'll be part of a small but growing team dedicated to providing excellent support for Smartoptics products. Your primarily working place will be in our facilities in Kista.


**Position summary**
--------------------



Are you ready to dive into the world of technical support? We’re looking for a skilled and motivated Support Engineer to join our team at Smartoptics.



In this role, you will help customers with their technical issues and ensure they have a smooth experience using our products. If you enjoy solving problems, have great communication skills, and a strong technical background, we’d love to hear from you!



As a Support Engineer, you’ll play a key role in providing top-notch support while keeping business needs in mind. You'll handle a wide range of technical issues, from transceivers and traffic interfaces to optical line systems, including transponders and muxponders.


### **Responsibilities**


* Troubleshoot software and hardware issues, analyze problems, and find solutions quickly.
* Work closely with different teams to provide complete customer support.
* Be available for on-call support 24/7/365 as per a rotating schedule and during emergencies.

### **Required skills**


* Experience working in technical support, assisting customers via web, phone, and in-person.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently and follow up to ensure nothing is overlooked.
* Strong communication skills in **Swedish and English**, both spoken and written.
* Willingness to be on-call as per a set schedule.
* Ability to create documentation, including procedures, service bulletins, and manuals.

### **Merits:**


* Good understanding of **DWDM design** and optical components such as amplifiers, filters, WSS, and VOA.
* Knowledge of transceivers, including optical and management interfaces.
* Familiarity with **Linux** and how software interacts with hardware in embedded systems.

**What We Offer**
-----------------



We have a culture of openness and involvement. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and love being involved in problem-solving, there’s a great chance you’ll enjoy working with us! We have an ambitious roadmap ahead and offer strong development opportunities for our employees.


**About Smartoptics**
---------------------



Smartoptics is a Scandinavian company offering innovative fiber-optic network solutions and components for the new era of open networks. We solve technical challenges in networks to enhance our customers’ competitiveness. Smartoptics’ customer base today includes hundreds of companies, such as government clients, cloud providers, and cable and telecom operators.



Smartoptics was founded in 2006 and has its headquarters in Oslo. The Stockholm office houses about 70 great colleagues, characterized by a culture of innovation and drive. As for the company, there are currently 120 employees.



Our modern office is just a stone’s throw from the Kista subway station and the Helenelund commuter train station.


*Furthermore, note that you must have a Swedish/EU work permit and speak Swedish. No relocation assistance or visa support provided. No recruiters or agencies, please.*

title: Support Agent
description:
**About Us**

**nShift** is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.


Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!

  

If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.

**About you**

* You are naturally a spontaneous person who can communicate with ease and can work well with others
* You are an ambitious and commercially driven individual with a strong passion for customer service
* You have experience and a keen interest in understanding customers, partners, and software product features
* You thrive in fast-paced environments, demonstrating strong resilience and a dynamic, energetic approach to challenges

**Purpose of Role**


nShift is on an exciting growth journey, and we’re looking for a **Support Agent** to join our team in **Stockholm** to ensure our customers receive exceptional service. Our products play a critical role in our customers’ operations, so it’s essential that they function correctly. When issues arise, they need to be resolved quickly, professionally, and effectively.


In this role, you’ll handle a variety of support cases, collaborate with internal teams, assist partners with complex troubleshooting, and contribute to a dynamic, fast-paced work environment alongside your colleagues.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide technical support to customers and partners via phone and written communication
* Handle all types of incoming requests efficiently
* Ensure compliance with SLAs (Service Level Agreements)
* Deliver basic training to customers and colleagues
* Take a proactive approach to workload management
* Contribute to a strong, service-oriented team culture where knowledge sharing is key

**Required Qualifications:**

* Previous **customer service** experience
* Fluency in **Swedish and English** (mandatory)

**Bonus points for:**

* Experience in logistics
* Interest in IT and technical troubleshooting
* Knowledge of additional languages
* Previous experience in a SaaS company

**Required Skills and Personality Traits:**

* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Positive, team-oriented attitude with a passion for customer service
* Structured, organized, and independent approach to work
* Ability to understand customer needs, work with partners, and learn software features
* Comfortable adapting to change in a dynamic environment
* Resilient under pressure with high energy and problem-solving skills

**Meet your Manager**

**Sebastian Georgiadis - Manager, Customer Support**

**How long have you worked for nShift?**


I have worked here since November 2018. I started as a support agent and have been leading the team for about 4 years now.

 **What do you love about nShift?**


I really value the great relationships I have with my colleagues at nShift and the continuous growth I've experienced since joining the company. Every day brings new learning opportunities, which keeps things exciting. I also love that our services play a crucial role in global supply chains, making a real impact worldwide.

**What difference will this role make to nShift if I join ?**


In Customer Support, we are committed to providing the best possible experience for our customers, as consistently as we can, which is vital to many areas of the company. Your role will be crucial in achieving this, and having a team member who is eager to learn and adapt to different situations will make a significant impact.


At **nShift** we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal-opportunity employer which means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT ENGINEER TO NEDERMAN
description:
*Embark on a transformative journey with Nederman, shaping the future of IoT solutions for air filtration systems. As our new Technical Support Engineer this is your chance to dive into cutting-edge technical innovation, work with highly skilled colleagues in a dynamic team, and elevate your career with us. If you want to contribute to solutions that make a tangible difference in the world, Nederman is the place for you. We go beyond products; we create solutions that make a real impact.*

*As we embrace a more interconnected future with our IoT-enabled solutions and our new state-of-the-art office in Helsingborg, we invite passionate individuals to share our vision and be part of something truly transformative.*

### **Our product**


Our digital platform goes beyond traditional filters, providing key insights to optimize performance, reduced costs, and enhance environmental compliance. With a focus on connectivity, our OTC program spans cloud and gateway development, operations, and support, uniting industrial equipment seamlessly. Currently, our IoT-platform boasts a substantial client base and 15+ persons working with Nederman OTC.  

  



### **What you will do**


As one of our Technical Support Engineer, you will play an important role in delivering technical and product support for a globally distributed network of interconnected industrial and advanced measuring equipment. You will work to resolve issues using the telephone, email, and remote access tools. Your role extends to collaborating with both business and technical stakeholders to comprehend software functionality and contribute to the creation of comprehensive documentation for support and training purposes. Key tasks include:


* Commissioning and client configuration of new IoT systems
* Onboarding, training sessions, and learning activities for customers, Nederman sales companies, and field service technicians.
* Third-level support and troubleshooting software, hardware, and connectivity issues globally.
* Engage in some project management and roll-out of new platforms, including software version testing and device migration.
* Identify and report recurring and critical issues while offering feedback on best practices and functional improvements.


### **We believe you have**


We are looking for someone with several years of technical support experience. You should have a keen interest and knowledge with industrial controls/SCADA systems, electronics´ or computer networks. This could include experience within industrial PLCs, industrial software and/or industrial communication protocols. It is plus to have knowledge or interest for/with IoT devices.


We expect you to be flexible and resilient and committed to growing with the company. The environment is fast-paced and rewarding in a global setting and requires you to be endurant. The role also demands a highly collaborative approach and having a positive attitude. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills will be valuable, as well as having good written and verbal communication skills in English. To be organized and able to successfully handle multiple requests and tasks with an ownership approach is also an important part.


### **What we offer you**


At Nederman, you are part of a fast-growing international company with sustainability at its core, where your work contributes to efficient production, environmental benefits, and safer workplaces worldwide. Our culture is characterized by employees who care for each other and the planet, demonstrating the courage to act. We value continuous learning and offer extensive opportunities for you to develop your skills and knowledge through our global training platform.


At our headquarters in Helsingborg, we are thrilled to have moved into our new world-class facilities. Along with being part of this exciting journey, you will enjoy market-competitive compensation and benefits, including a generous annual healthcare allowance, as well as access to our local canteen, which serves subsidized lunches daily.


### **Apply today**


We are collaborating with Nexer Recruit regarding this recruitment. Please contact recruitment consultant Johanna Värmfors at Johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com, or +46 730 821 230 or Artan Bitiqi at artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com, or call +46 723 61 28 44 should you want to learn more about the position. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

### **About Nederman**

*At Nederman, we believe our role is to make life better by creating great products and solutions that protect people, planet and production. With around 2 100 employees, sales offices and distributors in over 50 countries and production in 12 countries on five continents, we´re one of the world's leading companies supplying products and solutions in the environmental technology sector focusing on industrial air filtration. We respect the environment and each other, have the courage to act and a sustainable customer focus. Listed on Nasdaq Stockholm Mid Cap. We are the Clean Air Company.*

title: Agil Projektledare - Release Train Engineer - Scrum Master
description:
***Som agil projektledare hos oss gör du skillnad genom att hjälpa våra kunder att driva digitaliseringsinitiativ och få organisation och team att fungera bättre – vill du vara med?***

**OM ROLLEN**
-------------

Som agil projektledare har du en nyckelroll i agil utveckling, i regel som produktägare, release train engineer eller scrum master. Du kommer att verka på både organisations- och teamnivå med fokus på att förstå affärsbehoven och verksamheten samt driva värdeskapande förändring.


Projekten kan till exempel vara inom följande områden:


* Realisera en förbättrad kundupplevelse i olika kanaler
* Systemutvecklingsprojekt baserat på digitala plattformar
* Utveckling av skräddarsydda lösningar baserad på olika teknologier
Effektivisera systemlandskap tex genom nya plattformar eller migrering till cloud  
* 

  

Vår starka position på marknaden med kunder som är Sveriges största och mest välkända både inom den publika och privata sektorn har gett oss möjligheten till omfattande åtaganden inom digital transformation. Det utmanar oss att ständigt utvecklas. Utmaningen som agil projektledare är att våra kunder har olika agil målbild.  



  

**DIN PROFIL**

* Erfarenhet av att leda team i digitaliseringsinitiativ
* Erfarenhet av att coacha och leda agila utvecklingsteam (ej hårdvara) i rollen som Produktägare, Release Train Engineer eller Scrum Master
* Kännedom om Jira/Confluence eller liknande
Goda kunskaper i såväl svenska som engelska  
* 

  

***… meriterande :***

* Scrum Master-certifiering
SAFe -certifiering  
* 

  

**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅR DIG ATT TRIVAS**

* En positiv arbetsmiljö med starkt fokus på innovation och kundnöjdhet. Du kommer att arbeta med många av de senaste trenderna och vara omgiven av skickliga kollegor.
* På Capgemini blir du en del av en global organisation med högt kundfokus, en samarbetskultur och möjlighet till kontinuerlig lärande och utveckling.
* Vårt Team i Stockholm består av medarbetare som levererar till publika och privata sektorn. Vi erbjuder även ett lokalt och internationellt nätverk inom agile delivery i Norden och världen så det finns alltid någon som kan hjälpa oss i det dagliga arbetet om vi behöver stöd i form av kunskap eller guidning för att lyckas leverera till våra kunder.
* Spännande karriärmöjligheter lokalt och internationellt, och fantastiska nätverk av expertis.
* Som anställd hos oss blir du blir en del av en vass, teknik- och affärsfokuserad gemenskap, Här kan du bla välja mellan 250 000 kurser som täcker det mesta, inkl certifieringar.﻿
* Du kommer återkommande ha en dialog med din teamchef om hur du vill och hur du utvecklas avseende uppdrag, utbildningar och kundnöjdhet
* Våra värderingar: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun
**OM CAPGEMINI**  

Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
  

  

Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
